Summary As a payments and fraud expert, it's my job to where two hats: that of the fraudster, always thinking of new ways to attack an ecosystem - and that of the merchant, where stopping fraud is just one out of 100 tasks at hand.  
 
As a Product Manager, it has been my pleasure to explore the interconnected world of fraud operations, machine learning, risk mitigation, and product design. I have helped mitigate fraud across multiple verticals: from ads, to the sharing economy, to e-commerce and travel. I have learned the universal truths that tie fraud in these industries together, as well as the challenges that are unique to each of these business models.  
 
Going forward, my concentration is on building the most robust fraud mitigation platform available in the payments processing industry today. Concentrating on automation, the customer experience, and achieving the perfect balance between risk mitigation and conversion optimization. Experience Senior Product Manager - Risk & Fraud Adyen April 2015  – Present (4 months) Amsterdam Area, Netherlands As the Senior Product Manager for Risk and Fraud at Adyen, I am solely responsible for driving the vision of our risk mitigation solutions within the company. This requires me to wear lots of hats from day-to-day, but generally this entails the following tasks: 
- Establishing product road-maps and KPIs. 
- Maintaining a consistent vision and philosophy towards the product, ensuring that all cross-functional partners are in alignment with those goals. 
- Establishing, and maintaining, a marketing and sales philosophy towards the product. 
- Establishing, and continually improving, our pricing strategy, based on engagement data and customer feedback.  
- Meeting face-to-face with current and prospective users to establish new development tasks and instill best practices.  
 Project Manager - Online Trust and Safety and Risk Airbnb July 2014  –  April 2015  (10 months) San Francisco Bay Area As a Project Manager in Online Trust and Safety and Risk at Airbnb, my primary focus is on reducing and automating our elimination of risk incidences across a wide spectrum of online risk vectors. In all, this include the following: 
 
•Establishing quarterly roadmaps for engineering and operationally driven projects in the online risk space. Writing Objectives and Key Results and ensuring follow through.  
 
•Ensuring that communication across engineering, data science, and operations occurs in an effective and efficient way, resulting in quicker implementation of new workflows and continual improvement of processes and tools.  
 
•Owning all projects within the online space, including account takeover mitigation, chargeback risk, fake inventory detection, phishing message thresholding, etc.  
 
•Hiring additional project managers for our team - creating job reqs, phone screening, establishing interview challenges, etc. Technical Project Manager - Ads Quality/Risk Google September 2013  –  July 2014  (11 months) Mountain View, CA As a Technical Project Manager in Ads Quality Operations, my primary focus is to liaison the complex relationship between risk analysts, the engineering team we work with, and the infrastructure team that supports our efforts. This involves the following: 
 
•Writing and overseeing the technical objectives and key results between operations, engineering, and infrastructure groups, focusing on tackling new and persisting fraud trends on Google’s ad platforms. 
 
•Managing the entire development cycle of emerging workflows and tool rollouts amongst both Infrastructure and Operational groups, utilizing Scrum/Agile Development.  
 
•Managing the development of a range of fraud prevention systems, including bank phishing models, analyst tools, cloaking detection systems, and machine-learning content classification models. 
 
•Interpreting large, SQL-based, data sets pertaining to fraud, in order to properly prioritize operational and engineering solutions to decrease fraud revenue impact and increase automation. 
 
•Working cross-functionally with other companies and fraud-related entities to integrate best practices, signals, and data-sharing pipelines. Ads Quality/Risk Strategist and North American Policy POC Google July 2012  –  September 2013  (1 year 3 months) Mountain View, CA I work to ensure that the ads on Google's network are high quality and ensure a positive experience for our users. I specialize in technical gaming and trend-based fraud prevention. 
 
•Perform as a strategist on a global policy and payment fraud enforcement team to identify and eliminate new fraud trends (personally responsible for over 40,000 customer reviews). 
 
•Work cross-functionally with partners in Engineering, Legal, Policy, Sales, and Operations. 
 
•Communicate extensively with Risk Engineering to develop new techniques and approaches to fight advanced gaming and cloaking. 
 
•Perform the duties of a locational POC - including project management, global consistency attainment, and partnerships with management on ensuring appropriate engineering focus. 
 
•Work as a POC for taking high-profile escalations from upper management, regulatory bodies, legal, and PR. 
 
•Specialize in developing new techniques to fight technical gaming and cloaking on our ad network. (Open) 1 honor or award Product Quality Operations Gold Award Received a global distinction award for my discovery and handling of a high-profile fraud case that impacted several cross-functional organizations across sales, operations, and engineering. Summary I've been working in a sales and customer relationship development role for over a year and a half at Google. I've helped over 750 clients improve their online advertising campaigns so that they saw better results and more business leads flow in.  
 
It is a very rewarding experience to work with small and medium business owners that might not have the expertise nor the time to devote to running a successful ad campaign. When we can work together to understand their clientele's user psychology, and I can educate them on creative solutions to develop their business strategy, it becomes quite fun for both our parties when they see the results come in. Specialties:Marketing, Field Research, Data Analysis and Forecasting.
